    • Controller

      public Controller()
      Description: Constructor of the Controller class. It initializes the groups array with two groups, "A" and "B". pre: The class should be instantiated. pos: The groups array is initialized with two groups.

    • preChargeInfo

      public void preChargeInfo()
      Description: Pre-loads information about the tournament, including name, start/end dates, pre-defined teams, players, and referees. pre: The class should be instantiated. pos: The `tournamentName`, `startDate`, `endDate`, `prevTeams`, `persons`, `centralReferees`, and `assistantReferees` arrays are populated with initial data. Eight teams with their respective players are created. Four central referees and eight assistant referees are also created.

    • registerTeams

      public boolean registerTeams(String name, String country, String coach)
      Description: This method registers a new team in the prevTeams array.
      Parameters:
      String - name The name of the team.
      String - country The country of the team.
      String - coach The coach of the team.
      Returns:
      True if the team was registered successfully, false otherwise. pre: The name, country and coach of the team should be provided. pos: The new team is added to the prevTeams array.

    • registerPlayers

      public boolean registerPlayers(String teamName, String id, String name, String country, int shirtNumber, int intPosition)
      Description: This method registers a new player in the persons array and adds it to the specified team.
      Parameters:
      String - teamName The name of the team to which the player will be added.
      String - id The player's identification.
      String - name The player's name.
      String - country The player's country of origin.
      int - shirtNumber The player's shirt number.
      int - intPosition An integer representing the player's position (1 for goalkeeper, 2 for defender, 3 for midfielder, 4 for forward).
      Returns:
      True if the player was registered and added to the team successfully, false otherwise. pre: The teamName must correspond to an existing team, the id should be unique, the intPosition must be within the range of 1 to 4 and the shirtNumber mustn't exist. pos: If the preconditions are met the new player is added to the persons array and to the team's players list. If not, the player is not registered and the method returns false.

    • addPlayerToTeam

      public boolean addPlayerToTeam(Player player, String team)
      Description: This method adds a player to a specific team.
      Parameters:
      Player - player The player to be added.
      String - teamName The name of the team to add the player to.
      Returns:
      True if the player was successfully added to the team, false otherwise. pre: The player object should be valid and the team with the given teamName must exist. Also the persons array and the team players array must not be full. pos: The player is added to the persons array and to the players array of the team. If the team is not found or if the maximum number of players is reached, the player is not added and the method returns false.

    • analyzeID

      public boolean analyzeID(String id)
      Description: This method analyzes if an ID already exists within the registered persons (players or referees).
      Parameters:
      String - id The ID to analyze.
      Returns:
      True if the ID already exists, false otherwise. pre: The id should be provided. pos: Returns true if the ID is found in either the players or referees lists, false otherwise.

    • analyzeNumber

      public boolean analyzeNumber(int shirtNumber)
      Description: This method analyzes if a shirt number already exists within the registered players.
      Parameters:
      int - shirtNumber The shirt number to analyze.
      Returns:
      True if the shirt number already exists, false otherwise. pre: The shirtNumber should be provided. pos: Returns true if the shirtNumber is found in the players list, false otherwise.

    • showPlayerInfo

      public String showPlayerInfo(String id, String team, String groupName)
      Description: This method displays the information of a specific player.
      Parameters:
      String - id The ID of the player to search for.
      Strig - teamName The name of the team the player belongs to. This helps narrow down the search if multiple players share the same ID.
      String - groupName The name of the group the team belongs to. This further specifies the search.
      Returns:
      A String containing the player's information if found, or a message indicating the player was not found. pre: The id, teamName, and groupName should be provided. The player with the given ID should exist within the specified team and group. pos: If the player is found, their information is returned as a String. If not, a message indicating that the player was not found is returned.

    • showPlayerList

      public String showPlayerList(String groupName, String teamName)
      Description: This method displays a list of players for a given team within a specific group.
      Parameters:
      String - groupName The name of the group the team belongs to.
      String - teamName The name of the team whose players are to be listed.
      Returns:
      A String containing a formatted list of players if the team and group exist, or an appropriate message if the group or team are not found. pre: The groupName and teamName should correspond to an existing group and team respectively. pos: A formatted string is returned listing the players' ID, name, shirt number, and position. If the group or team doesn't exist, a message indicating the error is returned.

    • registerReferees

      public boolean registerReferees(String id, String name, String country, int type)
      Description: This method registers a new referee in the system.
      Parameters:
      String - id The referee's identification.
      String - name The referee's name.
      String - country The referee's country of origin.
      String - type An integer representing the referee's type (1 for central, 2 for assistant).
      Returns:
      True if the referee was registered successfully, false otherwise. pre: The id should be unique and the type should be either 1 or 2. There should be available space in the corresponding referee array (centralReferees or assistantReferees) and the persons array. pos: If the preconditions are met, the new referee is added to the persons array and to the correct referee array (centralReferees or assistantReferees) based on their type. If the type is invalid, or if the maximum number of referees of the specified type is reached the referee is not added and the method returns false.

    • addReferee

      public boolean addReferee(Referee referee)
      Description: This method adds a referee to the appropriate referee array (either centralReferees or assistantReferees) and also to the persons array.
      Parameters:
      Referee - referee The referee object to be added.
      Returns:
      True if the referee was added successfully, false otherwise. pre: The referee object should be valid, and there should be space available in both the appropriate referee array (based on Rtype) and the persons array. pos: The referee is added to the persons array and to either the centralReferees or assistantReferees array, based on the referee's type. If no space is available in either array, the referee is not added and the method returns false.

    • searchCentralReferee

      public Referee searchCentralReferee(String id)
      Description: This method searches for a central referee by their ID.
      Parameters:
      Strinh - id The ID of the central referee to search for.
      Returns:
      The central referee if found, null otherwise. pre: The id should be a valid referee ID. pos: The central referee with the matching ID is returned. If no such referee is found, null is returned.

    • teamsList

      public String teamsList()
      Description: This method returns a string with the list of teams.
      Returns:
      A string with the list of teams. pre: The prevTeams array should be initialized. pos: A string with the list of teams is returned.

    • searchPlayer

      public Player searchPlayer(String id, String teamName, String groupName)
      Description: This method searches for a player within a specific team and group by their ID.
      Parameters:
      String - id The ID of the player to search for.
      String - teamName The name of the team the player belongs to.
      String - groupName The name of the group the team belongs to.
      Returns:
      The Player object if found, null otherwise. pre: The id, teamName, and groupName should be provided. pos: If a player with the matching ID is found within the specified team and group, the Player object is returned. Otherwise, null is returned.

    • addGoalsToPlayer

      public void addGoalsToPlayer(String teamName, String groupName, String id)
      Description: This method adds goals to a player's statistics.
      Parameters:
      String - teamName The name of the team the player belongs to.
      String - groupName The name of the group the team belongs to.
      String - id The ID of the player. pre: The teamName, groupName, and id should correspond to a valid team, group, and player, respectively. pos: The specified player's goal count is incremented. If the player is not found, no changes are made.

      String - groupName The name of the group the team belongs to.
      String - id The ID of the player. pre: The teamName, groupName, and id should correspond to a valid team, group, and player, respectively. pos: The specified player's assist count is incremented. If the player is not found, no changes are made.

      Parameters:
      String - teamName The name of the team the player belongs to.
      String - groupName The name of the group the team belongs to.
      String - id The ID of the player. pre: The teamName, groupName, and id should correspond to a valid team, group, and player, respectively. pos: The specified player's yellow card count is incremented. If the player is not found, no changes are made.

      Parameters:
      String - teamName The name of the team the player belongs to.
      String - groupName The name of the group the team belongs to.
      String - id The ID of the player. pre: The teamName, groupName, and id should correspond to a valid team, group, and player, respectively. pos: The specified player's red card count is incremented. If the player is not found, no changes are made.

    • getRefereeIdFromMatch

      public String getRefereeIdFromMatch(String groupName, String team1, String team2)
      Description: This method retrieves the ID of the central referee assigned to a specific match.
      Parameters:
      String - groupName The name of the group where the match took place.
      String - team1 The name of the first team in the match.
      String - team2 The name of the second team in the match.
      Returns:
      The ID of the central referee for the specified match, or null if the match is not found. pre: The groupName, team1, and team2 must correspond to a valid match. pos: The ID of the central referee is returned. If no match is found or if the match doesn't have an assigned referee, null is returned.

    • addCardToReferee

      public void addCardToReferee(String groupName, String team1, String team2, String refereeId)
      Description: This method adds a card to a referee's statistics during a specific match.
      Parameters:
      String - groupName The name of the group where the match took place.
      String - team1 The name of the first team in the match.
      String - team2 The name of the second team in the match.
      String - refereeId The ID of the referee who received the card. It is assumed the card is for the central referee. pre: The groupName, team1, team2, and refereeId must correspond to a valid match and referee. cardType must be a valid card type. pos: The specified referee's card count (either yellow or red depending on cardType) is incremented for the indicated match. If the referee or match is not found, no changes are made. No validation is performed to prevent excessive cards.

    • searchTeam

      public Team searchTeam(String teamName)

      Parameters:
      String - teamName The name of the team to search for.
      Returns:
      The team if it is found, null otherwise. pre: The team name should be provided. pos: The team is returned if it is found, null otherwise.

    • searchTeamInGroup

      public Team searchTeamInGroup(String groupName, String teamName)
      Description: This method searches for a team within a specific group by its name.
      Parameters:
      String - groupName The name of the group to search within.
      String - teamName The name of the team to search for.
      Returns:
      The Team object if found, null otherwise. pre: The groupName and teamName should be provided. pos: If a team with the matching teamName is found within the specified group, the Team object is returned. Otherwise, null is returned.

    • addMatchPlayed

      public String addMatchPlayed(String team1, String team2, String groupName, String idReferee)
      Description: This method adds a played match to a specific group.
      Parameters:
      String - team1 The name of the first team.
      String - team2 The name of the second team.
      String - groupName The name of the group to add the match to.
      String - idReferee The ID of the central referee for the match.
      Returns:
      A string indicating success or failure, including error messages if necessary. Could return the generated Match object's ID if successful. pre: The team1, team2, groupName, and idReferee should correspond to valid team names, a group name, and a central referee's ID respectively. The two teams should belong to the specified group. The referee should not be from the same country as either team. The match should not already exist in the group. pos: A new Match object is created and added to the specified group's matches array. The scores, goals, and assists are not recorded at this stage. Returns a success message, or a failure message indicating why the operation failed.

      public void generateGroups()
      Description: This method generates the groups for the tournament. pre: The prevTeams array should be initialized. pos: The groups array is filled with the generated groups.

      String - team2Name The name of the second team in the match.
      Returns:
      The match if it is found, null otherwise. pre: The names of the teams should be provided. pos: The match is returned if it is found, null otherwise.

      Description: This method schedules the matches for a given group.
      Parameters:
      Group - group The group for which to schedule the matches. pre: The group object should be provided. pos: The matches are scheduled for the given group.

    • generateMatches

      public void generateMatches()
      Description: This method generates the matches for the tournament. pre: The groups array should be initialized. pos: The matches are generated for each group.

    • showPendingMatches

      public String showPendingMatches(Group group)
      Description: This method sets the goals for a given match.
      Parameters:
      int - goalsTeam1 The goals scored by the first team.
      int - goalsTeam2 The goals scored by the second team. pre: The goals scored by each team should be provided. pos: The goals are set for the given match.

    • setGoals

      public String setGoals(String groupName, String team1, String team2, int goalsTeam1, int goalsTeam2)
      Description: This method sets the goals scored by each team in a specific match.
      Parameters:
      String - groupName The name of the group the match belongs to.
      String - team1 The name of the first team in the match.
      String - team2 The name of the second team in the match.
      int - goals1 The number of goals scored by the first team.
      int - goals2 The number of goals scored by the second team.
      Returns:
      A message indicating success or failure, including an explanation if the match isn't found. pre: The groupName, team1, and team2 must correspond to a valid, existing match within the tournament. goals1 and goals2 must be non-negative integers. pos: The specified match's scores are updated with the given goals. If the match isn't found, no changes are made, and an error message is returned.

    • calcTopGoalScorer

      public String calcTopGoalScorer()
      Description: This method calculates and returns the top goal scorer of the tournament.
      Returns:
      The Player object representing the top goal scorer, or null if no players have scored any goals. pre: The tournament must have started and player goal statistics must have been recorded. pos: The player with the highest number of goals in the tournament is returned. If multiple players are tied for the top spot, one of them is chosen arbitrarily.

    • calcFairPlay

      public String calcFairPlay()
      Description: This method calculates and returns the team with the best fair play score in the tournament.
      Returns:
      The Team object with the lowest accumulated penalty points (best fair play score), or null if no teams are registered or if no matches have been played. pre: The tournament should have started, teams should be registered, and matches should have been played. Cards issued during matches should have been recorded. pos: The team with the lowest sum of penalty points from yellow and red cards is returned. If multiple teams have the same lowest score, one of them is returned arbitrarily. Yellow cards are assumed to have a weight of 1 point and red cards a weight of 2 points (or another predefined weighting if specified in the Match or related classes.)

    • calcTeamEfficiency

      public double calcTeamEfficiency(String groupName, String teamName)
      Description: This method calculates and displays the efficiency of a specific team in the tournament.
      Parameters:
      String - groupName The name of the group in which the team participates.
      String - teamName The name of the team whose efficiency is to be calculated.
      Returns:
      A double as the calculation of team's efficiency, or a message indicating that the team or group was not found or that no matches have been played. pre: The tournament should have started, the team should be registered, and matches involving the team should have been played and results recorded. pos: A string representing the calculated efficiency of the specified team is returned. If the team or group is not found or if no matches have been played by the team, an appropriate message is returned instead.

    • calcPlayerEfficiency

      public double calcPlayerEfficiency(String playerId, String teamName, String groupName)
      Description: This method calculates and displays the efficiency of a specific player in the tournament.
      Parameters:
      String - groupName The name of the group the player's team belongs to.
      String - teamName The name of the team the player belongs to.
      String - playerId The ID of the player whose efficiency is to be calculated.
      Returns:
      A string representation of the player's efficiency, or a message indicating that the player, team, or group was not found. pre: The tournament should have started, the player should be registered, and matches involving the player's team should have been played with player statistics recorded. pos: A double result of the calculated efficiency of the specified player is returned. If the player, team or group are not found, an appropriate message is returned instead.

    • calcRefereeCardIndex

      public double calcRefereeCardIndex(String refereeId)
      Description: This method calculates and returns the index of a referee based on the number of cards they've issued.
      Parameters:
      String - refereeId The ID of the referee whose index is to be calculated.
      Returns:
      A string representing the referee's card index, or a message indicating that the referee was not found. The card index is calculated as cards given divided by games played. pre: The referee with the given ID should exist. Card statistics for the referee should have been recorded. pos: A string containing the calculated card index for the specified referee is returned. If the referee is not found, an appropriate message is returned.

    • generateLeaderboard

      public String generateLeaderboard(String groupName)
      Description: This method generates and returns the leaderboard for a specified group.
      Parameters:
      groupName - The name of the group for which to generate the leaderboard.
      Returns:
      A formatted string representing the leaderboard for the given group, or a message indicating the group was not found or no matches have been played. pre: The group with the specified groupName should exist. Matches within the group should have been played and results recorded. pos: A string containing the leaderboard is returned. The leaderboard should display teams ranked by points, considering tiebreakers if necessary (e.g., goal difference, goals scored, head-to-head results). If the group is not found or no matches have been played, an appropriate message is returned.
